definition: to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-

sentences.english: Department of flowing water, passer-by, I with the Sensation, nor mourning wisdom.

sentences.english: Think of school as just one facet of the larger self-education in your life.
sentences.chinese: 學校僅僅是你人生教育的過客罷了。

sentences.english: You're just a random person on TSR to me.
sentences.chinese: 在TSR上你對我來說只是一個過客。

sentences.english: Tears of worry about passing the year, yellow wine, respect the old neighborhood church.

sentences.english: Maybe we meet by chance or passing traveller of human society .
sentences.chinese: 也許萍水相逢，或許紅塵過客。

sentences.english: I am reluctant to admit that you are just a passer-by in my life.
sentences.chinese: 我一直不願意承認你是我生命中的過客。

sentences.english: Who said no, not only for the traveler friendship sweet.
sentences.chinese: 誰言異類無情義，只爲過客不留香。

sentences.english: At present I am a sojourner in civilized life again.
sentences.chinese: 目前，我又是文明生活中的過客了。

sentences.english: The shade of my tree is for passers-by, its fruit for the one for whom i wait.
sentences.chinese: 我的樹爲過客投下輕陰，果實則留給我等待的那個人。

sentences.english: I am a sojourner in your life, and you are my life eternal frames.
sentences.chinese: 我是你生命中的過客，而你是我這輩子永恆的定格。

sentences.english: I don't want to end up simply visited this word.

sentences.english: Originally I in your heart just a dispensable traveler just.
sentences.chinese: 原來我在你心中只是一個可有可無的過客罷了。

sentences.english: And if you decide to graduate from lurker to participant the gains are even greater.
sentences.chinese: 假如你從過客成爲參與者，那你的收穫將會更加巨大。

sentences.english: You have forgotten that you are only a guest here, just like us.
sentences.chinese: 你們忘記了你們只是這裏的一個過客，就像我們一樣。

sentences.english: Are we passers-by in the life of each other?Is our love bound to be a flash-in-the-pan?
sentences.chinese: 難道你我真的是生命中的過客，在生命中曇花一現嗎？

sentences.english: I'm just passing through, you wait for the return man is he?
sentences.chinese: 我只是個過客，你等待的歸人他在哪？

definition: the world of mortals (Buddhism)/human society/worldly affairs
to leave (on a long journey)/to part from sb
foreign land/a place far from home
in the end/after all is said and done
reluctant to leave/to hate to have to go/to recall fondly
to pay no attention to/to disregard/to ignore/to let go unpunished/to let off
to recollect/to recall (past times)/to look back
